slides.title: Origins of the Samurai
content: Derived from the word 'saburau', meaning 'to serve'
Originally tasked with protecting the estates of the noble class
image_prompts: Samurai warrior on horseback
Traditional samurai armor
Samurai training in a dojo

slides.title: Code of Bushido
content: Strict code of conduct followed by samurai
Included virtues such as courage, respect, and integrity
image_prompts: Samurai meditating under a cherry blossom tree
Samurai performing a tea ceremony
Illustration of the seven virtues of Bushido

slides.title: Weaponry and Fighting Techniques
content: Famous weapons: katana (longsword) and wakizashi (short sword)
Martial arts training: kenjutsu (swordsmanship) and kyujutsu (archery)
Strategies and tactics: 'Ichi-ryu' (one-strike school) and 'Niten-Ichi-ryu' (two-sword style)
image_prompts: Samurai wielding a katana in battle
Samurai practicing archery
Illustration of different samurai fighting stances

slides.title: End of the Samurai Era
content: Modernization and decline in the late 19th century
Legacy and influence on Japanese culture and martial arts

slides.title: Samurai in Popular Culture
content: Depicted in numerous films, books, and video games
Famous examples: 'Seven Samurai', 'The Last Samurai', 'Ghost of Tsushima'
Symbol of honor, discipline, and legendary swordsmanship
